bboxes.reason: The bounding box with index 10 best fits the upper_element_temperature_dial. It correctly encompasses the entire dial knob, which is the primary control element for adjusting the upper element temperature. This dial is located at the top of the control panel and has temperature markings around it, indicating its function for temperature control.

The bounding box with index 7 best fits the function_dial element. It encompasses the entire dial knob, which is the primary control for selecting the oven's function. This matches the criteria for dial selection, as it covers the interactive part of the control element without including unnecessary surrounding areas.

The bounding box with index 11 accurately encompasses the lower temperature dial, which is the third dial from the top. This dial is clearly labeled with temperature markings (150°F, 250°F, 350°F) and includes the 'OFF' position, indicating it controls the lower element temperature. The bounding box correctly focuses on the dial knob itself, which is the primary interactive element for adjusting the temperature.

Bounding box 13 best fits the timer dial criteria. It encompasses the entire knob of the timer dial, which is the primary control element for setting the timer. This bounding box captures the full circular dial, including its textured edge, which is the interactive part used to adjust the timer settings.
